titleStmt.title: William Edmonds to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6087

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: The undersigned William Edmonds, is a cripple for life, unable to earn a support by manual labour -- was fined ten years ago in two cases for keeping a tippling house. I discontinued business from that date, and have since been trying to earn a Support selling groceries in a small way, From Sympathy I suppose nothing was done with the executions until quite lately, when the matter was revived and if Compelled to pay, it will take all I am worth to pay I therefore petition your excellency to remit them

Mason Cir Ct
vs
Wm Edmonds
2 judgts
$60 -- each
Remitted
3rd Jany 1865
